lines.text: My dear Mrs. Hudson, you've always been a temptation to me, but haddock after a good breakfast is not.
Lawd, and you do carry on!
You know, Watson, although I've known Holmes for some years, I sometimes wonder if he's all there.

[to Moriarity]
It's very interesting, Moriarity, but your five minutes is up!

lines.character: Prof. Robert Moriarty, alias Col. Henslowe

lines.text: [Adair turns around and sees no one]

lines.character: Prof. Robert Moriarty, alias Col. Henslowe

lines.text:
[Realizing that the voice is coming from a painting of a cardinal]
Oh, my God! Am I drunk?
I hope not at ten o'clock in the morning.
lines.character: Prof. Robert Moriarty, alias Col. Henslowe

lines.text:
[to Kathleen]
A summons from you comes before even a summons from Sherlock Holmes.

[to his fellow bridge players as he leaves the game]
No, don't get up. I hope you all win.
Rest assured, after he has seen me, he shall never gamble again.
May I offer you a piece of advice? Never give in to sudden impulses. They're even more dangerous than you and I am.
